modules.description: This module provides low-level functions to manually manage input and output buffers for decoders and encoders. It allows specifying byte ranges in `Bytes.t` buffers for reading or writing, supporting non-blocking streaming operations. Use it when implementing custom input/output logic that requires precise control over buffer usage.

This module folds over UTF-encoded characters in OCaml strings, supporting UTF-8, UTF-16BE, and UTF-16LE encodings. It processes substrings with optional byte order mark (BOM) handling, tracking character positions and decoding sequences incrementally. Use it to analyze or transform Unicode text stored in strings, such as parsing UTF-16 encoded log entries or validating UTF-8 content.

This module provides functions to encode Unicode characters into UTF-8, UTF-16BE, and UTF-16LE formats and append them to a `Buffer.t` instance. It operates directly on `Buffer.t` and `Uchar.t` types, enabling efficient character-by-character encoding without intermediate string allocations. Use cases include building UTF-encoded text buffers incrementally, such as when generating output for network protocols or file formats requiring specific encodings.
